message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE. 

The paper presents a novel approach to the question answering task using linguistic structures such as syntactic and semantic trees, which are commonly used in natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) research. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves indexing and ranking documents based on relevance scores, which are common techniques in IR research, suggesting cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as another likely sub-category. The use of statistical modeling to learn weights associated with the fields suggests cs.LG (Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as additional likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper's focus on improving the baseline approach for detecting documents containing answers suggests cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as a possible sub-category.
